item.title: Destiny 2: Opaque Hourglass God Roll
item.description:
Destiny 2: The Edge of Fate brings forth a new and exciting weapon type, the Combat Bow. As of the release of The Edge of Fate , there is only one Combat Bow, and that's the Opaque Hourglass. This legendary Power Ammo weapon provides players with what's effectively a crossbow in Destiny 2 , and it's extremely fun to use for those who know how to get it and what perks to use to get themselves the Opaque Hourglass god roll. Without further ado, check out below how to farm this weapon and the god roll stats.

How to Get Opaque Hourglass

Opaque Hourglass is an exclusive drop from the Desert Perpetual raid, meaning players will need The Edge of Fate expansion and must complete the campaign. Players can farm Opaque Hourglass from the Epoptes, Lord of Quanta encounter, and once players have their first drop if this Combat Bow, they will be able to farm it repeatedly without relying on a weekly reset. Players can also spend 20 Spoils of Conquest at the raid vendor for another Opaque Hourglass drop, but players must have beaten Koregos, the Worldline, the final encounter of the raid, for this kiosk to appear at the end. In terms of weapon design, the Opaque Hourglass is very cool, but the perks are somewhat limited, thus making it a Heavy Weapon that doesn't provide the damage that it could. Still, there's a PvE god roll below to look for when it comes to boss damage.

Opaque Hourglass PvE God Roll in Destiny 2

Rail

Frictionless Rail

Bolt

Charged Bolts

Perk 1

Field Prep

Perk 2

Vorpal Weapon

Masterwork

Persistence

Mod

Flight

Origin Trait

Frame of Reference

Frictionless Rail will increase both the reload speed and projectile speed of Opaque Hourglass, making it a more reliable weapon to fire to counter its slow effects. The best Bolt to use for Opaque Hourglass is the Charged Bolts provide a damage over time effect, meaning players can stack damage with other weapons, hot-swapping to different weapons to provide consistent and constant damage to stun and weaken enemies. For the 1st Perk, Field Prep is a good choice because the ammo supply is limited (when players aren't picking up their bolts), so an increase to reload speed, stow speed, and ready speed, while crouching, is a great way to keep damage up and fast against bosses. Really, any perk works depending on how players want to use Opaque Hourglass, but for damage against Minibosses and Bosses being a focus, Vorpal Weapon will be a great choice for a 10% damage buff.

Opaque Hourglass is not viable for PvP, so there will be no God Roll provided for the Crucible.

item.title: Fortnite: How to Favorite a Creator
item.description:
The Summer Road Trip quests offer up some neat cosmetic rewards for players of both Fortnite and Rocket League . One of the quests that has confused a few players is the one that requires players to 'favorite a creator.' While this isn't something that's difficult to do in premise, the option is tucked away in the menus of Fortnite , and so can be quite difficult to find if you've not really explored Creator profiles before. In this guide, I'll show you how to favorite a creator in Fortnite quickly, so you can tick this Summer Road Trip quest off your list.

How to Favorite a Creator in Fortnite

Two Quick and Easy Methods to Complete the Quest

To favorite a creator, select the magnifying glass 'search' icon in the upper left of the lobby screen and enter a creator's name. When you land on their profile page, select the 'Favorite' button and click it to add them to your favorite list .

There are thousands of creators in Fortnite , and if you know the name of the creator of an island or other content that you're a fan of, you can choose to favorite them. However, if you're not familiar with creators in Fortnite and just want to complete the quest quickly, you can simply use one of the most popular creators listed below to get the quest completed.

  • HIVE
  • GAKO
  • BULLSEYE
  • GOODGAMERS
  • FERINS
  • THEBOYDILLY
  • PANDVIL
  • THEPITLAND
  • UNC

Alternatively, you can go to the 'Play' tab, select one of the created experiences under the 'For You' section, and click on the three dots in the bottom right corner of the experience's image. Select the 'View Creator' option, and then click the 'Favorite' button once you're taken to their profile .

You'll know that you've successfully favorited a creator as you'll get a notification informing you that you've completed the Summer Road Trip quest for doing so. You'll then receive the Homebase Banner icon, shown below.

What Does Favoriting a Creator in Fortnite Do?

Easier to Find

By favoriting a creator, you'll make it easier to find their latest islands. It is essentially a metric that can be used to show the amount of support a creator has within the game, which they can track within their Creator Portal. Beyond that, it doesn't do too much else, so don't worry too much about it impacting your Fortnite experience in some major way.

If you don't want to favorite any creator, as soon as the quest has been marked as complete, you can go and unfavorite the creator again. The quest will still be marked as complete so you can get your Summer Road Trip rewards.

item.title: 8 Horror Games With Misunderstood Villains
item.description:
Summary

  • Mind-bending stories in horror games can recontextualize villains, revealing their true nature and driving captivating twists.
  • Horror games like Silent Hill 2 and Inscryption blur lines between hero and villain, creating engaging narratives.
  • The Last of Us Part 2 highlights the destructive nature of revenge, humanizing villains like Abby in a complex way.

Horror games can accomplish something special if they manage to sink their claws into players. Mind-bending stories are an easy way to achieve this, compelling gamers to see events and characters in a new light.

This also stretches to the villains present in most horror games. Some of said figures seem like cookie-cutter bad guys, only for it to be revealed later that they hide a sinister secret or something along the same lines that recontextualizes their actions. This can lead to memorable twists that explore what it means to be evil in captivating ways.

Warning: This list contains major spoilers for the games being discussed.

8 Silent Hill 2

It Becomes Evident That Players Are Exploring James Sunderland's Psyche, After A Point

Silent Hill 2
9 /10
69
9.1 /10
Released
October 8, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Language, Sexual Themes, Violence
Powered by

Most players who start Silent Hill 2 have no idea what's going on, although James' quest to find his wife seems noble enough. The dreaded Pyramid Head spends a large portion of the game hunting James, but the reason why isn't made clear from the get-go.

It's not until much later in the game that the truth comes to light. The many enemies that James saw during his time in Silent Hill represent parts of his guilty conscience, with Pyramid Head manifesting because of his guilt and wanting to be punished for killing his wife when she needed his support.

7 Mouthwashing

The True Villain Of This Game Takes A While To Rear His Ugly Head

6 Images
6 Images
Mouthwashing
9.0 /10
Released
September 26, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Wrong Organ
Publisher(s)
Critical Reflex
Engine
Unity
Powered by

A short, memorable horror game that takes place on a spaceship, the psychological horror of Mouthwashing is in a class of its own. The first scene of the game leads players to think that they are controlling the captain who causes the ship to crash, but this is not the case.

The mind-bending narrative jumps at different points in the story and manages to weave an intricate narrative that makes Jimmy's guilt clear as day. By the time players realize that he's the villain, they have no choice but to see this story to completion as this narcissist dooms everyone around him.

6 Inscryption

Leshy Is Far From The Game's Villain

Inscryption
8.8 /10
Released
October 19, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

Inscryption is one of the best horror games ever made, with its foreboding atmosphere and unique deck-building gameplay being an absolute treat to experience. With Leshy trapping players and forcing them to play the game over and over again, it's easy to assume that he's a villain.

However, Inscryption recontextualizes itself with its second and third acts, making things more apparent for players. It reaches a point where players will actively cheer when they get to face Leshy, with emotions spilling over as the game is deleted and the time spent with this memorable character is cut short.

5 Omori

Sunny's Tragic Story Eventually Reveals The Villain Who's Bogging Him Down

OMORI
9.0 /10
Released
December 25, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

It's hard to discern who the villain is in Omori . Barring the cute, cheerful bosses in Headspace, the most ominous presence in the game is Something, which haunts players every step of the way and manifests as nightmares that Sunny and Omori must deal with.

However, once the truth of the story comes to light, it's clear that the real villain of the game is Omori himself, although even that is debatable. Either way, Sunny must take Omori out and face his guilt so that he can own up to his friends and respect Basil's wishes, too.

4 P.T.

It's Easy To Be Afraid Of Lisa Without Knowing What Happened To Her

P.T.
Survival Horror
Systems
5.5 /10
Released
August 12, 2014
ESRB
m

Powered by

The looping hallway of P.T. is eerie enough as it is, and things only become more unsettling for players when they encounter the jittery ghost of Lisa. The fact that she jump scares players and becomes an obstacle that they must overcome makes for a truly terrifying sight.

However, as the story surrounding this hallway comes to light, Lisa becomes a sympathetic figure who players learn didn't deserve the atrocities that her husband inflicted on her. All of this is told via some horrific imagery that turned P.T. into a gaming phenomenon.

3 Slay The Princess

Who The Villain And Hero Of This Story Are Can Be Rather Dynamic

6 Images
6 Images
Slay the Princess
9.3 /10
Released
October 23, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
nr
Powered by

Throughout Slay the Princess , players are told over and over again that they must kill the princess, who is a demonic entity of sorts. While this may be true in some paths, there's more to this issue than what meets the eye; players encounter the princess on numerous branching paths, and she can take on all kinds of shapes and forms.

Even the role of the player itself is in doubt, with them slowly piecing things together to realize that there aren't any true villains here. There's just an eternal divine conflict between two gods that is told in a fascinating and cryptic way.

2 Bloodborne

Players Must Read The Lore To Understand Who The True Villains Of This Story Are, If There Is One To Begin With

6 Images
6 Images
Bloodborne
21
9.0 /10
Released
March 24, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Violence
Powered by

As players power through Bloodborne and fight the many nightmarish bosses that stand in their way, it's clear that something isn't quite right. Bosses who seem like they've lost their minds feel more tragic than cathartic to fight, and nowhere is this more apparent than in the battle against Gerhman, who is the final boss unless players ingested the Umbilical Cords they found during their travels.

His story is a tragic one and doesn't make him seem like a villain in the slightest. One can argue that even the Old Ones aren't villains, with humans going mad as they tried to exploit their power and knowledge for their selfish gain.

1 The Last Of Us Part 2

Abby's Controversial Presence Makes This One Of The Most Impactful Video Games Of All Time

The Last of Us Part 2
10 /10
13
7.5 /10
Released
June 19, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Drugs
Powered by

The poster child of complex villain tales, The Last of Us Part 2 features a clear message. Revenge is bad, and it will consume everything in its wake, which is something that both Ellie and Abby come to know incredibly well.

After getting her revenge on Joel, Abby sees her friends drop one by one as a result of Ellie's quest for revenge. The game makes it a point to humanize her actions while also agreeing that revenge was not the path she should have sought, with a players' enjoyment of this title stemming from whether they resonated with Abby's story or not.

item.title: Civilization 7 - Official Genghis Khan Reveal Trailer
item.description: Genghis Khan, the founder of the Mongol Empire, is heading to Civilization 7. Take a look at the character's official reveal trailer here.
